citation.article-title: Longispora fulva sp. nov., isolated from a forest soil, and emended description of the genus Longispora
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Longispora Matsumoto et al. 2003
The description is as given by Matsumoto et al. (2003) with the following amendments.
Galactose and xylose are the major sugars in whole-cell hydrolysates; arabinose, rhamnose, mannose and ribose may be detected.
The diagnostic phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylinositol (phospholipid type II).
In addition, hydroxyphosphatidylethanolamine and several unknown lipids and glycolipids may be present.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, 10-methyl-C17 : 0 and iso-C17 : 1ω9c (fatty acid type 3b).
